name: Accrued Interest (IPAC)
elements.definition: Accrued interest as per Status Date (SD). In case of NULL, this value will be recalculated using Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX), Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) and Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) information. Can be used to represent irregular next Interest Payment (IP) payments.

name: Amortization Date (AMD)
elements.definition: This Date is used to calculate the annuity amounts for Annuity (ANN) and Exotic Annuity (ANX) Contract Types (CT's). Needs only to be set in case where there is a contract balloon at Maturity Date (MD) and Maturity Date (MD) is less than Amortization Date (AMD).

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
elements.definition: Business Day Conventions (BDC's) are linked to a calendar. Calendars have working and non-working days. A Business Day Convention (BDC) value other than N means that cash flows cannot fall on non-working days, they must be shifted to the next business day (following) or the previous on (preceding).These two simple rules get refined twofold:- Following modified (preceding): Same like following (preceding), however if a cash flow gets shifted into a new month, then  it is shifted to preceding (following) business day.- Shift/calculate (SC) and calculate/shift (CS). Accrual, principal, and possibly other calculations are affected by this choice. In the case of SC first the dates are shifted and after the shift cash flows are calculated. In the case of CS it is the other way round.Attention: Does not affect non-cyclical dates such as Purchase Date (PRD), Maturity Date (MD), Termination Date (TD), Capitalization End Date (IPCED) since they can be set to the correct date directly.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
No Shift
elements.definition: No shift applied to non-business days.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
elements.definition: Calendar defines the non-working days which affect the dates of contract events (CDE's) in combination with End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC). Custom calendars can be added as additional enum options.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
No Calendar
elements.definition: No holidays defined

name: Calendar (CLDR)
MondayToFriday
elements.definition: Saturdays and Sundays are holidays

name: Capitalization End Date (IPCED)
elements.definition: If Capitalization End Date (IPCED) is set, then interest is not paid or received but added to the balance (Notional Principal (NT)) until Capitalization End Date (IPCED). If Capitalization End Date (IPCED) does not coincide with an Interest Payment (IP) cycle, one additional interest payment gets calculated at Capitalization End Date (IPCED) and capitalized. Thereafter normal interest payments occur.

name: Contract Deal Date (CDD)
elements.definition: This date signifies the origination of the contract where an agreement between the customer and the bank has been settled. From this date on, the institution will have a (market) risk position for financial contracts. This is even the case when Initial Exchange Date (IED) is in future.

name: Contract Identifier (CID)
elements.definition: Unique identifier of a contract.  If the system is used on a single firm level, an internal unique ID can be generated. If used on a national or globally level, a globally unique ID is required.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
elements.definition: Indicates the current contract performance status. Different states of the contract range from performing to default.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Performant
elements.definition: Contract is performing according to terms and conditions.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delayed
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delayed according to the Grace Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delinquent
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delinquent according to the Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Default
elements.definition: Contract defaulted on payment obligations according to Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Matured
elements.definition: Contract matured.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Terminated
elements.definition: Contract has been terminated.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
elements.definition: Contract Role (CNTRL) defines which position the Creator Identifier (CRID) ( the creator of the contract record ) takes in a contract. For example, whether the contract is an asset or liability, a long or short position for the Creator Identifier (CRID). Most contracts are simple on or off balance sheet positions which are assets, liabilities. Such contracts can also play a secondary role as a collateral. The attribute is highly significant since it determines the direction of all cash flows. The exact meaning is given with each Contract Type (CT) in the ACTUS High Level Specification document.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Asset
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the asset or lender side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Liability
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the liability or borrower side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Buyer
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the right to buy the underlying / exercise the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Seller
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the obligation to sell the underlying / deliver the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Collateral Position
elements.definition: Contract represents a collateral to an underlying instrument

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Close out Netting
elements.definition: Contract creator and counterparty agree on netting payment obligations of underlying instruments in case of default.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Plus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the asset side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Minus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the liability side.

name: Contract Type (CT)
elements.definition: The ContractType is the most important information. It defines the cash flow generating pattern of a contract. The ContractType information in combination with a given state of the risk factors will produce a deterministic sequence of cash flows which are the basis of any financial analysis.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Principal at Maturity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with full amortization at maturity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Annuity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. The periodic payments are adjusted for variable rate instruments such that maturity remains fixed.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Negative Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. Maturity changes for variable rate instruments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed principal repayment amounts and variable interest payments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Exotic Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with exotic repayment schedules.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Call Money
elements.definition: Lonas that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Undefined Maturity Profile
elements.definition: Interest paying cash accounts (current / savings / etc.).

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cash
elements.definition: Represents cash holdings.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Stock
elements.definition: Represents stocks/shares/equity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Commodity
elements.definition: Represents commodities.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Swap
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two legs such as fixed against variable or currency 1 against currency 2 etc.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Plain Vanilla Swap
elements.definition: Plain vanilla interest rate swaps.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Foreign Exchange Outright
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two cash flows in different currencies at a future point in time.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cap and Floor
elements.definition: An agreement of paying the differential (cap or floor) of a reference rate versus a fixed rate.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Future
elements.definition: An agreement of exchanging an underlying instrument against a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Option
elements.definition: Different types of options on buying an underlying instrument at a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Guarantee
elements.definition: A guarantee / letter of credit by a third party on the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Collateral
elements.definition: A collateral securing the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Counterparty Identifier (CPID)
elements.definition: Counterparty Identifier (CPID) identifies the counterparty to the Creator Identifier (CRID) in this contract.Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is ideally the official LEI which can be a firm, a government body, even a single person etc. However, this can also refer to a annonymous group in which case this information is not to be disclosed. Counterparty Identifier (CPID) may also refer to a group taking a joint risk or more generally, Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is the main counterparty, against which the contract has been settled.

name: Credit Line Amount (CLA)
elements.definition: If defined, gives the total amount that can be drawn from a credit line. The remaining amount that can still be drawn is given by Credit Line Amount (CLA)-Notional Principal (NT). For Annuity (ANN) or Negative Amortizer (NAM) only, the credit line can only be drawn prior to Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (PRANX)-1 Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL).

name: Currency (CUR)
elements.definition: The currency of the cash flows.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the fee payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first fee payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the interest calculation base date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest calculation base event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the interest payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Optionality (OPANX)
elements.definition: Used for Basic Maturities (such as Principal at Maturity (PAM), Annuity (ANN) and their Step-up versions) and American and Bermudan style options. - Basic Maturities: Within the group of these Maturities, it indicates the possibility of prepayments. Prepayment features are controlled by Behavior. - American and Bermudan style Options: Begin of exercise period.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (PRANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the principal payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first principal payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (PRANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the rate reset date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first rate reset event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the scaling date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first scaling event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Of Fee (FECL)
elements.definition: Defines in combination with Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX) the payment points of fees.

name: Cycle Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBCL)
elements.definition: Concerning the format see Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL). Defines the subsequent adjustment points to Notional Principal (NT) of the interest payment calculation base.

name: Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the interest payment date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) is not set, then there will only be an interest payment event at Maturity Date (MD) (and possibly at Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX) if set).The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Optionality (OPCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the option exercise date schedule will be calculated.Cycle Of Optionality (OPCL) can be NULL for American Options or Prepayment Optionality in which case the optionality period starts at Cycle Anchor Date Of Optionality (OPANX) and ends at Option Exercise End Date (OPXED) (for american options) or Maturity Date (MD) (in case of prepayment optionality).The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the interest payment date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL) is not set, then there will only be one principal payment event at Maturity Date (MD) (and possibly at Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (PRANX) if set).The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Rate Reset (RRCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the rate reset date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Rate Reset (RRCL) is not set, then there will only be one rate reset event at Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) given Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) if set.The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Scaling Index (SCCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the scaling date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Scaling Index (SCCL) is not set, then there will only be one scaling event at Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX) given Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX) is set.The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
elements.definition: Method defining how days are counted between two dates. This finally defines the year fraction in accrual calculations.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual/Actual
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty Five
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 365 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty ISDA
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period (ISDA method).

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Twenty Eight E Three Thirty Six
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 28 days per month and 336 days per year in the respective period.

name: Delinquency Period (DQP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus DLP, then the counterparty is in technical default. This means that the creditor legally has the right to declare default of the debtor.

name: Delinquency Rate (DQR)
elements.definition: Rate at which Delinquency Payments accrue on Notional Principal (NT) (in addition to the interest rate) during the DelinquencyPeriod.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
elements.definition: When computing schedules a special problem arises if an anchor date is at the end of a month and a cycle of monthly or quarterly is applied (yearly in the case of leap years only). How do we have to interpret an anchor date April 30 plus 1M cycles? In case where EOM is selected, it will jump to the 31st of May, then June 30, July 31 and so on. If SM is selected, it will jump to the 30st always with of course an exception in February. This logic applies for all months having 30 or less days and an anchor date at the last day. Month with 31 days will at any rate jump to the last of the month if anchor date is on the last day.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
Same Day
elements.definition: Schedule times always fall on the schedule anchor date day of the month.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
End of Month
elements.definition: Schedule times fall on the end of every month if the anchor date represents the last day of the respective month.

name: Fee Accrued (FEAC)
elements.definition: Accrued fees as per Status Date (SD).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
elements.definition: Basis, on which Fee is calculated. For Fee Basis (FEB)=’A’, Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount to be paid at every Fee Payment (FP) event and for Fee Basis (FEB)=’N’, Fee Rate (FER) represents a rate at which Fee Payment (FP) amounts accrue on the basis of the contract’s Notional Principal (NT).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Absolute Value
elements.definition: The fee rate represents an absolute value.

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Nominal Value of the Underlying
elements.definition: The fee rate represents a rate that accrues fees on the basis of the nominal value of the underlying.

name: Fee Rate (FER)
elements.definition: Rate of Fee which is a percentage of the underlying or Fee Rate (FER) is an absolute amount. For all contracts where Fee Basis (FEB) does not apply (cf. business rules), Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount.

name: Fixing Period (RRFIX)
elements.definition: Interest rate resets (adjustments) are usually fixed one or two days (usually Business Days) before the new rate applies (defined by the rate reset schedule). This field holds the period between fixing and application of a rate.

name: Grace Period (GRP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus Grace Period (GRP), then the payment is in delay.

name: Initial Exchange Date (IED)
elements.definition: Date of the initial cash flow for Maturity and Non-Maturity Contract Types (CT's). It also coincides with the beginning of interest accrual calculation.

name: Interest Calculation Base (IPCB)
elements.definition: This is important for amortizing instruments. The basis of interest calculation is normally the notional outstanding amount as per Status Date (SD). This is considered the fair basis and in many countries is the only legal basis. If NULL or Notional Outstanding (NT) is selected, this is the case. Alternative bases (normally in order to favor the lending institution) are sometimes used. In the extreme case the original balance, called the Notional at Initial Exchange (NTIED) is used and the NTIED is used to compute interest obligations. An intermediate case exists for which balances do get adjusted, however, with a lag. In this case the Notional Outstanding Lagged (NTL) must be selected and anchor dates and cycles must be set in order to compute the accrual of interest obligations.

name: Interest Calculation Base (IPCB)
Notional Outstanding
elements.definition: Interest accrues on the basis of the notional outstanding.

name: Interest Calculation Base (IPCB)
Notional at Initial Exchange
elements.definition: Interest accrues on the basis of the notional value at initial exchange.

name: Interest Calculation Base (IPCB)
Notional Outstanding Lagged
elements.definition: Interest accrues on the basis of the lagged notional outstanding.

name: Interest Calculation Base Amount (IPCBA)
elements.definition: This is the amount used for the calculation of interest. Calculation base per Status Date (SD).

name: Interest Scaling Multiplier (SCIP)
elements.definition: The multiplier being applied to interest cash flows.

name: Life Cap (RRLC)
elements.definition: For variable rate basic Contract Type (CT)s this represents a cap on the interest rate that applies during the entire lifetime of the contract.For Cap Floors (CAPFL) Contract Type (CT)s this represents the cap strike rate.

name: Life Floor (RRLF)
elements.definition: For variable rate basic Contract Type (CT)s this represents a floor on the interest rate that applies during the entire lifetime of the contract.For Cap Floors (CAPFL) Contract Type (CT)s this represents the floor strike rate.

name: Market Object Code (MOC)
elements.definition: Is pointing to the market value at Status Date (SD) (MarketObject).Unique codes for market objects must be used.

name: Market Object Code Of Rate Reset (RRMO)
elements.definition: Is pointing to the interest rate driver (MarketObject) used for rate reset uniquely.Unique codes for market objects must be used.

name: Market Value Observed (MVO)
elements.definition: Value as observed in the market at Status Date (SD) per unit. Incase of fixed income instruments it is a fraction.

name: Maturity Date (MD)
elements.definition: Marks the contractual end of the lifecycle of a Contract Type (CT). Generally, date of the last cash flows. This includes normally a principal and an interest payment. Some Maturity Contract Type (CT)s as perpetuals (Perpetual Bonds (PBN)) do not have such a date. For variable amortizing contracts of the Annuity (ANN) Contract Type (CT), this date might be less than the scheduled end of the contract (which is deduced from the periodic payment amount Next Principal Redemption Payment (PRNXT)). In this case it balloons.

name: Next Principal Redemption Payment (PRNXT)
elements.definition: Amount of principal that will be paid during the redemption cycle at the next payment date. For amortizing contracts like Annuity (ANN), Negative Amortizer (NAM), Exotic Annuity (ANX), and Exotic Negative Amortizer (NAX) this is the total periodic payment amount (sum of interest and principal).

name: Next Reset Rate (RRNXT)
elements.definition: Holds the new rate that has been fixed already (cf. attribute FixingDays) but not applied. This new rate will be applied at the next rate reset event (after Status Date (SD) and according to the rate reset schedule). Attention, Next Reset Rate (RRNXT) must be set to NULL after it is applied!

name: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR)
elements.definition: The nominal interest rate which will be used to calculate accruals and the next interest payment at the next Interest Payment (IP) date. Notional Principal (NT) multiplied with Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) is the base for the interest payment calculation. The relevant time period is a function of Day Count Convention (IPDC). If the contract is variable (Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) set) this field is periodically updated per Status Date (SD). In the case of plan vanilla interest rate swaps (IRSPV) this defines the rate of fixed leg.

name: Non Performing Date (NPD)
elements.definition: The date of the (uncovered) payment event responsible for the current value of the Contract Performance attribute.

name: Notional Principal (NT)
elements.definition: Current nominal value of the contract. For debt instrument this is the current remaining notional outstanding. Notional Principal (NT) is generally the basis on which interest payments are calculated. If Interest Calculation Base Amount (IPCBA) is set, Interest Calculation Base Amount (IPCBA) may introduce a different basis for interest payment calculation.

name: Notional Scaling Multiplier (SCNT)
elements.definition: The multiplier being applied to principal cash flows.

name: Option Exercise End Date (OPXED)
elements.definition: Final exercise date for American and Bermudan options, expiry date for European options.

name: Penalty Rate (PYRT)
elements.definition: Either the rate or the absolute amount of the prepayment.

name: Penalty Type (PYTP)
elements.definition: Defines whether prepayment is linked to a penalty and of which kind.

name: Penalty Type (PYTP)
No Penalty
elements.definition: No penalty applies.

name: Penalty Type (PYTP)
Fixed Penalty
elements.definition: A fixed amount applies as penalty.

name: Penalty Type (PYTP)
Relative Penalty
elements.definition: A penalty relative to the notional outstanding applies.

name: Penalty Type (PYTP)
Interest Rate Differential
elements.definition: A penalty based on the current interest rate differential relative to the notional outstanding applies.

name: Period Cap (RRPC)
elements.definition: For variable rate basic Contract Type (CT)s this represents the maximum positive rate change per rate reset cycle.

name: Period Floor (RRPF)
elements.definition: For variable rate basic Contract Type (CT)s this represents the maximum negative rate change per rate reset cycle.

name: Premium Discount At IED (PDIED)
elements.definition: Total original premium or discount that has been set at Contract Deal Date (CDD) and will be added to the (notional) cash flow at Initial Exchange Date (IED) (cash flow at Initial Exchange Date (IED) = Notional Principal (NT) + Premium/or Discount At Initial Exchange Date (PDIED)). The sign of a Premium is Positive and the sign of a Discount is Negative.

name: Prepayment Effect (PPEF)
elements.definition: This attribute defines whether or not the right of prepayment exists and if yes, how prepayment affects the remaining principal redemption schedule of the contract.

name: Prepayment Effect (PPEF)
No Prepayment
elements.definition: Prepayment is not allowed under the agreement.

name: Prepayment Effect (PPEF)
Prepayment Reduces Redemption Amount
elements.definition: Prepayment is allowed and reduces the redemption amount for the remaining period up to maturity.

name: Prepayment Effect (PPEF)
Prepayment Reduces Maturity
elements.definition: Prepayment is allowed and reduces the maturity.

name: Prepayment Period (PPP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens before scheduled payment date minus Prepayment Period (PPP), then it is considered a prepayment. Effect of prepayments are further described in Prepayment Effect (PPEF) and related fields.

name: Price At Purchase Date (PPRD)
elements.definition: Purchase price exchanged at Purchase Date (PRD).  Price At Purchase Date (PPRD) represents a clean price (includes premium/discount but not Accrued Interest (IPAC)).

name: Price At Termination Date (PTD)
elements.definition: Sellingprice exchanged at Price At Termination Date (PTD)  Price At Termination Date (PTD)represents a clean price (includes premium/discount but not Accrued Interest (IPAC).

name: Purchase Date (PRD)
elements.definition: If a contract is bought after initiation (for example a bond on the secondary market) this date has to be set. It refers to the date at which the payment (of Price At Purchase Date (PPRD)) and transfer of the security happens. In other words, Purchase Date (PRD) - if set - takes the role otherwise Initial Exchange Date (IED) has from a cash flow perspective. Note, Counterparty Identifier (CPID) of the Contract Type (CT) is not the counterparty of the transaction!

name: Rate Multiplier (RRMLT)
elements.definition: Interest rate multiplier. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.However, in some cases like reverse or super floater contracts an additional rate multiplier applies. In this case, the new rate is determined as: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object * Rate Multiplier (RRMLT) + Rate Spread (RRSP).

name: Rate Spread (RRSP)
elements.definition: Interest rate spread. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.  The following equation can be taken if Rate Multiplier (RRMLT) is not set: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object  + Rate Spread (RRSP).

name: Scaling Effect (SCEF)
elements.definition: Indicates which payments are scaled. I = Interest payments, N = Nominal payments and M = Maximum deferred interest amount. They can be scaled in any combination.

name: Scaling Effect (SCEF)
No Scaling
elements.definition: No scaling applies.

name: Scaling Effect (SCEF)
Interest is Scaled
elements.definition: Scaling applies only to interest.

name: Scaling Effect (SCEF)
Principal is Scaled
elements.definition: Scaling applies only to principal.

name: Scaling Effect (SCEF)
Interest and Principal is Scaled
elements.definition: Scaling applies to interest and principal.

name: Scaling Index At Contract Deal Date (SCCDD)
elements.definition: The value of the Scaling Index as per Contract Deal Date.

name: Seniority (SEN)
elements.definition: Refers to the order of repayment in the event of a sale or default of the issuer. .

name: Seniority (SEN)
Senior
elements.definition: Contract represents senior debt.

name: Seniority (SEN)
Junior
elements.definition: Contract represents junior debt.

name: Settlement Currency (CURS)
elements.definition: The currency in which cash flows are settled. This currency can be different from the currency (CUR) in which cash flows or the contract, respectively, is denominated in which case the respective FX-rate applies at settlement time.If no settlement currency is defined the cash flows are settled in the currency in which they are denominated.

name: Status Date (SD)
elements.definition: Status Date (SD) holds the date per which all attributes of the record were updated. This is especially important for the highly dynamic attributes like Accruals, Notional, interest rates in variable instruments etc.

name: Termination Date (TD)
elements.definition: If a contract is sold before Maturity Date (MD) (for example a bond on the secondary market) this date has to be set. It refers to the date at which the payment (of Price At Termination Date (PTD)) and transfer of the security happens. In other words, Termination Date (TD) - if set - takes the role otherwise Maturity Date (MD) has from a cash flow perspective. Note, Counterparty Identifier (CPID) of the Contract Type (CT) is not the counterparty of the transaction!

name: Debt - Annuity (ANN)
definition: Principal payment fully at Initial Exchange Date (IED) and interest plus principal repaid periodically in constant amounts till Maturity Date (MD). If variable rate, total amount for interest and principal is recalculated to be fully matured at Maturity Date (MD). Classical level payment mortgages, leasing contracts etc.

name: Accrued Interest (IPAC)
elements.definition: Accrued interest as per Status Date (SD). In case of NULL, this value will be recalculated using Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX), Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) and Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) information. Can be used to represent irregular next Interest Payment (IP) payments.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
elements.definition: Business Day Conventions (BDC's) are linked to a calendar. Calendars have working and non-working days. A Business Day Convention (BDC) value other than N means that cash flows cannot fall on non-working days, they must be shifted to the next business day (following) or the previous on (preceding).These two simple rules get refined twofold:- Following modified (preceding): Same like following (preceding), however if a cash flow gets shifted into a new month, then  it is shifted to preceding (following) business day.- Shift/calculate (SC) and calculate/shift (CS). Accrual, principal, and possibly other calculations are affected by this choice. In the case of SC first the dates are shifted and after the shift cash flows are calculated. In the case of CS it is the other way round.Attention: Does not affect non-cyclical dates such as Purchase Date (PRD), Maturity Date (MD), Termination Date (TD), Capitalization End Date (IPCED) since they can be set to the correct date directly.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
No Shift
elements.definition: No shift applied to non-business days.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
elements.definition: Calendar defines the non-working days which affect the dates of contract events (CDE's) in combination with End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC). Custom calendars can be added as additional enum options.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
No Calendar
elements.definition: No holidays defined

name: Calendar (CLDR)
MondayToFriday
elements.definition: Saturdays and Sundays are holidays

name: Contract Deal Date (CDD)
elements.definition: This date signifies the origination of the contract where an agreement between the customer and the bank has been settled. From this date on, the institution will have a (market) risk position for financial contracts. This is even the case when Initial Exchange Date (IED) is in future.

name: Contract Identifier (CID)
elements.definition: Unique identifier of a contract.  If the system is used on a single firm level, an internal unique ID can be generated. If used on a national or globally level, a globally unique ID is required.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
elements.definition: Indicates the current contract performance status. Different states of the contract range from performing to default.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Performant
elements.definition: Contract is performing according to terms and conditions.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delayed
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delayed according to the Grace Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delinquent
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delinquent according to the Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Default
elements.definition: Contract defaulted on payment obligations according to Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Matured
elements.definition: Contract matured.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Terminated
elements.definition: Contract has been terminated.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
elements.definition: Contract Role (CNTRL) defines which position the Creator Identifier (CRID) ( the creator of the contract record ) takes in a contract. For example, whether the contract is an asset or liability, a long or short position for the Creator Identifier (CRID). Most contracts are simple on or off balance sheet positions which are assets, liabilities. Such contracts can also play a secondary role as a collateral. The attribute is highly significant since it determines the direction of all cash flows. The exact meaning is given with each Contract Type (CT) in the ACTUS High Level Specification document.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Asset
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the asset or lender side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Liability
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the liability or borrower side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Buyer
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the right to buy the underlying / exercise the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Seller
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the obligation to sell the underlying / deliver the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Collateral Position
elements.definition: Contract represents a collateral to an underlying instrument

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Close out Netting
elements.definition: Contract creator and counterparty agree on netting payment obligations of underlying instruments in case of default.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Plus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the asset side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Minus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the liability side.

name: Contract Type (CT)
elements.definition: The ContractType is the most important information. It defines the cash flow generating pattern of a contract. The ContractType information in combination with a given state of the risk factors will produce a deterministic sequence of cash flows which are the basis of any financial analysis.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Principal at Maturity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with full amortization at maturity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Annuity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. The periodic payments are adjusted for variable rate instruments such that maturity remains fixed.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Negative Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. Maturity changes for variable rate instruments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed principal repayment amounts and variable interest payments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Exotic Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with exotic repayment schedules.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Call Money
elements.definition: Lonas that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Undefined Maturity Profile
elements.definition: Interest paying cash accounts (current / savings / etc.).

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cash
elements.definition: Represents cash holdings.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Stock
elements.definition: Represents stocks/shares/equity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Commodity
elements.definition: Represents commodities.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Swap
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two legs such as fixed against variable or currency 1 against currency 2 etc.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Plain Vanilla Swap
elements.definition: Plain vanilla interest rate swaps.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Foreign Exchange Outright
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two cash flows in different currencies at a future point in time.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cap and Floor
elements.definition: An agreement of paying the differential (cap or floor) of a reference rate versus a fixed rate.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Future
elements.definition: An agreement of exchanging an underlying instrument against a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Option
elements.definition: Different types of options on buying an underlying instrument at a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Guarantee
elements.definition: A guarantee / letter of credit by a third party on the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Collateral
elements.definition: A collateral securing the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Counterparty Identifier (CPID)
elements.definition: Counterparty Identifier (CPID) identifies the counterparty to the Creator Identifier (CRID) in this contract.Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is ideally the official LEI which can be a firm, a government body, even a single person etc. However, this can also refer to a annonymous group in which case this information is not to be disclosed. Counterparty Identifier (CPID) may also refer to a group taking a joint risk or more generally, Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is the main counterparty, against which the contract has been settled.

name: Currency (CUR)
elements.definition: The currency of the cash flows.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the fee payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first fee payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the interest payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the rate reset date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first rate reset event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Of Fee (FECL)
elements.definition: Defines in combination with Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX) the payment points of fees.

name: Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the interest payment date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) is not set, then there will only be an interest payment event at Maturity Date (MD) (and possibly at Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX) if set).The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Rate Reset (RRCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the rate reset date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Rate Reset (RRCL) is not set, then there will only be one rate reset event at Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) given Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) if set.The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
elements.definition: Method defining how days are counted between two dates. This finally defines the year fraction in accrual calculations.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual/Actual
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty Five
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 365 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty ISDA
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period (ISDA method).

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Twenty Eight E Three Thirty Six
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 28 days per month and 336 days per year in the respective period.

name: Delinquency Period (DQP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus DLP, then the counterparty is in technical default. This means that the creditor legally has the right to declare default of the debtor.

name: Delinquency Rate (DQR)
elements.definition: Rate at which Delinquency Payments accrue on Notional Principal (NT) (in addition to the interest rate) during the DelinquencyPeriod.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
elements.definition: When computing schedules a special problem arises if an anchor date is at the end of a month and a cycle of monthly or quarterly is applied (yearly in the case of leap years only). How do we have to interpret an anchor date April 30 plus 1M cycles? In case where EOM is selected, it will jump to the 31st of May, then June 30, July 31 and so on. If SM is selected, it will jump to the 30st always with of course an exception in February. This logic applies for all months having 30 or less days and an anchor date at the last day. Month with 31 days will at any rate jump to the last of the month if anchor date is on the last day.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
Same Day
elements.definition: Schedule times always fall on the schedule anchor date day of the month.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
End of Month
elements.definition: Schedule times fall on the end of every month if the anchor date represents the last day of the respective month.

name: Fee Accrued (FEAC)
elements.definition: Accrued fees as per Status Date (SD).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
elements.definition: Basis, on which Fee is calculated. For Fee Basis (FEB)=’A’, Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount to be paid at every Fee Payment (FP) event and for Fee Basis (FEB)=’N’, Fee Rate (FER) represents a rate at which Fee Payment (FP) amounts accrue on the basis of the contract’s Notional Principal (NT).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Absolute Value
elements.definition: The fee rate represents an absolute value.

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Nominal Value of the Underlying
elements.definition: The fee rate represents a rate that accrues fees on the basis of the nominal value of the underlying.

name: Fee Rate (FER)
elements.definition: Rate of Fee which is a percentage of the underlying or Fee Rate (FER) is an absolute amount. For all contracts where Fee Basis (FEB) does not apply (cf. business rules), Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount.

name: Fixing Period (RRFIX)
elements.definition: Interest rate resets (adjustments) are usually fixed one or two days (usually Business Days) before the new rate applies (defined by the rate reset schedule). This field holds the period between fixing and application of a rate.

name: Grace Period (GRP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus Grace Period (GRP), then the payment is in delay.

name: Initial Exchange Date (IED)
elements.definition: Date of the initial cash flow for Maturity and Non-Maturity Contract Types (CT's). It also coincides with the beginning of interest accrual calculation.

name: Market Object Code Of Rate Reset (RRMO)
elements.definition: Is pointing to the interest rate driver (MarketObject) used for rate reset uniquely.Unique codes for market objects must be used.

name: Maturity Date (MD)
elements.definition: Marks the contractual end of the lifecycle of a Contract Type (CT). Generally, date of the last cash flows. This includes normally a principal and an interest payment. Some Maturity Contract Type (CT)s as perpetuals (Perpetual Bonds (PBN)) do not have such a date. For variable amortizing contracts of the Annuity (ANN) Contract Type (CT), this date might be less than the scheduled end of the contract (which is deduced from the periodic payment amount Next Principal Redemption Payment (PRNXT)). In this case it balloons.

name: Next Reset Rate (RRNXT)
elements.definition: Holds the new rate that has been fixed already (cf. attribute FixingDays) but not applied. This new rate will be applied at the next rate reset event (after Status Date (SD) and according to the rate reset schedule). Attention, Next Reset Rate (RRNXT) must be set to NULL after it is applied!

name: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR)
elements.definition: The nominal interest rate which will be used to calculate accruals and the next interest payment at the next Interest Payment (IP) date. Notional Principal (NT) multiplied with Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) is the base for the interest payment calculation. The relevant time period is a function of Day Count Convention (IPDC). If the contract is variable (Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) set) this field is periodically updated per Status Date (SD). In the case of plan vanilla interest rate swaps (IRSPV) this defines the rate of fixed leg.

name: Non Performing Date (NPD)
elements.definition: The date of the (uncovered) payment event responsible for the current value of the Contract Performance attribute.

name: Notional Principal (NT)
elements.definition: Current nominal value of the contract. For debt instrument this is the current remaining notional outstanding. Notional Principal (NT) is generally the basis on which interest payments are calculated. If Interest Calculation Base Amount (IPCBA) is set, Interest Calculation Base Amount (IPCBA) may introduce a different basis for interest payment calculation.

name: Prepayment Period (PPP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens before scheduled payment date minus Prepayment Period (PPP), then it is considered a prepayment. Effect of prepayments are further described in Prepayment Effect (PPEF) and related fields.

name: Rate Multiplier (RRMLT)
elements.definition: Interest rate multiplier. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.However, in some cases like reverse or super floater contracts an additional rate multiplier applies. In this case, the new rate is determined as: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object * Rate Multiplier (RRMLT) + Rate Spread (RRSP).

name: Rate Spread (RRSP)
elements.definition: Interest rate spread. A typical rate resetting rule is LIBOR plus x basis point where x represents the interest rate spread.  The following equation can be taken if Rate Multiplier (RRMLT) is not set: Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) after rate reset = Rate selected from the market object  + Rate Spread (RRSP).

name: Seniority (SEN)
elements.definition: Refers to the order of repayment in the event of a sale or default of the issuer. .

name: Seniority (SEN)
Senior
elements.definition: Contract represents senior debt.

name: Seniority (SEN)
Junior
elements.definition: Contract represents junior debt.

name: Settlement Currency (CURS)
elements.definition: The currency in which cash flows are settled. This currency can be different from the currency (CUR) in which cash flows or the contract, respectively, is denominated in which case the respective FX-rate applies at settlement time.If no settlement currency is defined the cash flows are settled in the currency in which they are denominated.

name: Status Date (SD)
elements.definition: Status Date (SD) holds the date per which all attributes of the record were updated. This is especially important for the highly dynamic attributes like Accruals, Notional, interest rates in variable instruments etc.

name: X Day Notice (XDN)
elements.definition: Used as rolling attribute with the callable Contract Types (CT's) Undefined Maturity Profile (UMP) and Call Money (CLM) uniquely. Call Money (CLM)'s and Undefined Maturity Profile (UMP)'s will not be settled (Maturity Date (MD) not set) until the client uses his option to call the contract X_Day_Notice after Current Date. As long as Maturity Date (MD) or Termination Date (TD) is not set, the client postpones his right to call to the future. The cycle is normally defined in number of business days.

name: Debt - Call Money (CLM)
definition: Loans that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period. Interbank loans with call features.

name: Accrued Interest (IPAC)
elements.definition: Accrued interest as per Status Date (SD). In case of NULL, this value will be recalculated using Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX), Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) and Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) information. Can be used to represent irregular next Interest Payment (IP) payments.

name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (ARIPANX)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (IPANX) but as array.

name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Payment (ARIPANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (ARPRANX)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (PRANX) but as array.

name: Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (ARRRANX)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Anchor Date Of Rate Reset (RRANX) but as array.

name: Array Cycle Of Interest Payment (ARIPCL)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) but as array.

name: Array Cycle Of Principal Redemption (ARPRCL)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL) but as array.

name: Array Cycle Of Rate Reset (ARRRCL)
elements.definition: Same like Cycle Of Rate Reset (RRCL) but as array.

name: Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR)
elements.definition: For array-type rate reset schedules, this attributes defines the meaning of Array Rate (ARRATE).

name: Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR)
Fixed Rate
elements.definition: Rate spread represents a fixed rate.

name: Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR)
Variable Rate
elements.definition: Rate spread represents the spread on top of a reference rate.

name: Array Increase Decrease (ARINCDEC)
elements.definition: Indicates whether a certain Next Principal Redemption Payment (PRNXT) element in Array Cycle Anchor Date Of Principal Redemption (ARPRANX) increases the principal (Notional Principal (NT)) or decreases it.Applies only for Exotic Annuity (ANX), Exotic Negative Amortizer (NAX), Exotic Linear Amortizer (LAX) Maturity Contract Type (CT)s. For all other Maturity Contract Type (CT)s the first principal payment is always in the opposite direction of all other (following) payments.

name: Array Increase Decrease (ARINCDEC)
Increase
elements.definition: Notional is increased in this period.

name: Array Increase Decrease (ARINCDEC)
Decrease
elements.definition: Notional is decreased in this period.

name: Array Next Principal Redemption Payment (ARPRNXT)
elements.definition: Same like Next Principal Redemption Payment (PRNXT) but as array.

name: Array Rate (ARRATE)
elements.definition: For array-type rate reset schedules, this attribute represents either an interest rate (corresponding to Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR)) or a spread (corresponding to Rate Spread (RRSP)). Which case applies depends on the attribute Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR): if Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR)=FIX then it represents the new Nominal Interest Rate (IPNR) and if Array Fixed Variable (ARFIXVAR)=VAR then the applicable Rate Spread (RRSP).

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
elements.definition: Business Day Conventions (BDC's) are linked to a calendar. Calendars have working and non-working days. A Business Day Convention (BDC) value other than N means that cash flows cannot fall on non-working days, they must be shifted to the next business day (following) or the previous on (preceding).These two simple rules get refined twofold:- Following modified (preceding): Same like following (preceding), however if a cash flow gets shifted into a new month, then  it is shifted to preceding (following) business day.- Shift/calculate (SC) and calculate/shift (CS). Accrual, principal, and possibly other calculations are affected by this choice. In the case of SC first the dates are shifted and after the shift cash flows are calculated. In the case of CS it is the other way round.Attention: Does not affect non-cyclical dates such as Purchase Date (PRD), Maturity Date (MD), Termination Date (TD), Capitalization End Date (IPCED) since they can be set to the correct date directly.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
No Shift
elements.definition: No shift applied to non-business days.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Following
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the next following business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Following
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the next following business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the most recent preceding business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Shift-Calculate Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Shift event dates first then calculate accruals etc. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Strictly shift to the most recent preceding business day.

name: Business Day Convention (BDC)
Calculate-Shift Modified-Preceding
elements.definition: Calculate accruals etc. first then shift event dates. Shift to the most recent preceding business day if this falls in the same month. Shift to the next following business day otherwise.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
elements.definition: Calendar defines the non-working days which affect the dates of contract events (CDE's) in combination with End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC). Custom calendars can be added as additional enum options.

name: Calendar (CLDR)
No Calendar
elements.definition: No holidays defined

name: Calendar (CLDR)
MondayToFriday
elements.definition: Saturdays and Sundays are holidays

name: Capitalization End Date (IPCED)
elements.definition: If Capitalization End Date (IPCED) is set, then interest is not paid or received but added to the balance (Notional Principal (NT)) until Capitalization End Date (IPCED). If Capitalization End Date (IPCED) does not coincide with an Interest Payment (IP) cycle, one additional interest payment gets calculated at Capitalization End Date (IPCED) and capitalized. Thereafter normal interest payments occur.

name: Contract Deal Date (CDD)
elements.definition: This date signifies the origination of the contract where an agreement between the customer and the bank has been settled. From this date on, the institution will have a (market) risk position for financial contracts. This is even the case when Initial Exchange Date (IED) is in future.

name: Contract Identifier (CID)
elements.definition: Unique identifier of a contract.  If the system is used on a single firm level, an internal unique ID can be generated. If used on a national or globally level, a globally unique ID is required.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
elements.definition: Indicates the current contract performance status. Different states of the contract range from performing to default.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Performant
elements.definition: Contract is performing according to terms and conditions.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delayed
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delayed according to the Grace Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Delinquent
elements.definition: Contractual payment obligations are delinquent according to the Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Default
elements.definition: Contract defaulted on payment obligations according to Delinquency Period.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Matured
elements.definition: Contract matured.

name: Contract Performance (PRF)
Terminated
elements.definition: Contract has been terminated.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
elements.definition: Contract Role (CNTRL) defines which position the Creator Identifier (CRID) ( the creator of the contract record ) takes in a contract. For example, whether the contract is an asset or liability, a long or short position for the Creator Identifier (CRID). Most contracts are simple on or off balance sheet positions which are assets, liabilities. Such contracts can also play a secondary role as a collateral. The attribute is highly significant since it determines the direction of all cash flows. The exact meaning is given with each Contract Type (CT) in the ACTUS High Level Specification document.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Asset
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the asset or lender side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Real Position Liability
elements.definition: Contract creator takes the liability or borrower side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay First Leg
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the first leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Receive Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator receives the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Pay Fix
elements.definition: Contract creator pays the fixed leg.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Buyer
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the right to buy the underlying / exercise the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Seller
elements.definition: Contract creator holds the obligation to sell the underlying / deliver the option.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Collateral Position
elements.definition: Contract represents a collateral to an underlying instrument

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Close out Netting
elements.definition: Contract creator and counterparty agree on netting payment obligations of underlying instruments in case of default.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Plus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the asset side.

name: Contract Role (CNTRL)
Underlying Minus
elements.definition: Contract represents the underlying to a composed contract. Role of the underlying is derived from the parent. When considered a standalone contract the underlying’s creator takes the liability side.

name: Contract Type (CT)
elements.definition: The ContractType is the most important information. It defines the cash flow generating pattern of a contract. The ContractType information in combination with a given state of the risk factors will produce a deterministic sequence of cash flows which are the basis of any financial analysis.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Principal at Maturity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with full amortization at maturity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Annuity
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. The periodic payments are adjusted for variable rate instruments such that maturity remains fixed.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Negative Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed periodic payments consisting of an interest and principal portion. Maturity changes for variable rate instruments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with fixed principal repayment amounts and variable interest payments.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Exotic Linear Amortizer
elements.definition: Lending agreements with exotic repayment schedules.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Call Money
elements.definition: Lonas that are rolled over as long as they are not called. Once called it has to be paid back after the stipulated notice period.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Undefined Maturity Profile
elements.definition: Interest paying cash accounts (current / savings / etc.).

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cash
elements.definition: Represents cash holdings.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Stock
elements.definition: Represents stocks/shares/equity.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Commodity
elements.definition: Represents commodities.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Swap
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two legs such as fixed against variable or currency 1 against currency 2 etc.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Plain Vanilla Swap
elements.definition: Plain vanilla interest rate swaps.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Foreign Exchange Outright
elements.definition: An agreement of swapping two cash flows in different currencies at a future point in time.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Cap and Floor
elements.definition: An agreement of paying the differential (cap or floor) of a reference rate versus a fixed rate.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Future
elements.definition: An agreement of exchanging an underlying instrument against a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Option
elements.definition: Different types of options on buying an underlying instrument at a fixed price in the future.

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Guarantee
elements.definition: A guarantee / letter of credit by a third party on the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Contract Type (CT)
Credit Enhancement Collateral
elements.definition: A collateral securing the scheduled payment obligations of an underlying instrument

name: Counterparty Identifier (CPID)
elements.definition: Counterparty Identifier (CPID) identifies the counterparty to the Creator Identifier (CRID) in this contract.Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is ideally the official LEI which can be a firm, a government body, even a single person etc. However, this can also refer to a annonymous group in which case this information is not to be disclosed. Counterparty Identifier (CPID) may also refer to a group taking a joint risk or more generally, Counterparty Identifier (CPID) is the main counterparty, against which the contract has been settled.

name: Currency (CUR)
elements.definition: The currency of the cash flows.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the fee payment date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first fee payment event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the interest calculation base date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first interest calculation base event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Anchor Date Of Optionality (OPANX)
elements.definition: Used for Basic Maturities (such as Principal at Maturity (PAM), Annuity (ANN) and their Step-up versions) and American and Bermudan style options. - Basic Maturities: Within the group of these Maturities, it indicates the possibility of prepayments. Prepayment features are controlled by Behavior. - American and Bermudan style Options: Begin of exercise period.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX)
elements.definition: Date from which the scaling date schedule is calculated according to the cycle length. The first scaling event takes place on this anchor.

name: Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX)
ISO8601 Datetime
Cycle Of Fee (FECL)
elements.definition: Defines in combination with Cycle Anchor Date Of Fee (FEANX) the payment points of fees.

name: Cycle Of Interest Calculation Base (IPCBCL)
elements.definition: Concerning the format see Cycle Of Principal Redemption (PRCL). Defines the subsequent adjustment points to Notional Principal (NT) of the interest payment calculation base.

name: Cycle Of Optionality (OPCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the option exercise date schedule will be calculated.Cycle Of Optionality (OPCL) can be NULL for American Options or Prepayment Optionality in which case the optionality period starts at Cycle Anchor Date Of Optionality (OPANX) and ends at Option Exercise End Date (OPXED) (for american options) or Maturity Date (MD) (in case of prepayment optionality).The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Of Scaling Index (SCCL)
elements.definition: Cycle according to which the scaling date schedule will be calculated.In case Cycle Of Scaling Index (SCCL) is not set, then there will only be one scaling event at Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX) given Cycle Anchor Date Of Scaling Index (SCANX) is set.The interval will be adjusted yet by End Of Month Convention (EOMC) and Business Day Convention (BDC).

name: Cycle Point Of Interest Payment (IPPNT)
elements.definition: Usually, interest is paid at the end of each Cycle Of Interest Payment (IPCL) which corresponds to a Cycle Point Of Interest Payment (IPPNT) value of E which is also the default. If interest payment occurs at the beginning of the cycle, the value is B.

name: Cycle Point Of Interest Payment (IPPNT)
Beginning
elements.definition: Interest is paid upfront of the interest period.

name: Cycle Point Of Interest Payment (IPPNT)
End
elements.definition: Interest is paid at the end of the interest period.

name: Cycle Point Of Rate Reset (RRPNT)
elements.definition: Normally rates get reset at the beginning of any resetting cycles. There are contracts where the rate is not set at the beginning but at the end of the cycle and then applied to the previous cycle (post-fixing); in other words the rate applies before it is fixed. Hence, the new rate is not known during the entire cycle where it applies. Therefore, the rate will be applied backwards at the end of the cycle. This happens through a correction of interest accrued.

name: Cycle Point Of Rate Reset (RRPNT)
Beginning
elements.definition: The new rate is applied at the beginning of the reset period.

name: Cycle Point Of Rate Reset (RRPNT)
End
elements.definition: The new rate is applied at the end of the reset period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
elements.definition: Method defining how days are counted between two dates. This finally defines the year fraction in accrual calculations.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual/Actual
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Actual Three Sixty Five
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of the actual number of days per month and 365 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty ISDA
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period (ISDA method).

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Thirty E Three Sixty
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 30 days per month and 360 days per year in the respective period.

name: Day Count Convention (IPDC)
Twenty Eight E Three Thirty Six
elements.definition: Year fractions accrue on the basis of 28 days per month and 336 days per year in the respective period.

name: Delinquency Period (DQP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus DLP, then the counterparty is in technical default. This means that the creditor legally has the right to declare default of the debtor.

name: Delinquency Rate (DQR)
elements.definition: Rate at which Delinquency Payments accrue on Notional Principal (NT) (in addition to the interest rate) during the DelinquencyPeriod.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
elements.definition: When computing schedules a special problem arises if an anchor date is at the end of a month and a cycle of monthly or quarterly is applied (yearly in the case of leap years only). How do we have to interpret an anchor date April 30 plus 1M cycles? In case where EOM is selected, it will jump to the 31st of May, then June 30, July 31 and so on. If SM is selected, it will jump to the 30st always with of course an exception in February. This logic applies for all months having 30 or less days and an anchor date at the last day. Month with 31 days will at any rate jump to the last of the month if anchor date is on the last day.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
Same Day
elements.definition: Schedule times always fall on the schedule anchor date day of the month.

name: End Of Month Convention (EOMC)
End of Month
elements.definition: Schedule times fall on the end of every month if the anchor date represents the last day of the respective month.

name: Fee Accrued (FEAC)
elements.definition: Accrued fees as per Status Date (SD).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
elements.definition: Basis, on which Fee is calculated. For Fee Basis (FEB)=’A’, Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount to be paid at every Fee Payment (FP) event and for Fee Basis (FEB)=’N’, Fee Rate (FER) represents a rate at which Fee Payment (FP) amounts accrue on the basis of the contract’s Notional Principal (NT).

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Absolute Value
elements.definition: The fee rate represents an absolute value.

name: Fee Basis (FEB)
Nominal Value of the Underlying
elements.definition: The fee rate represents a rate that accrues fees on the basis of the nominal value of the underlying.

name: Fee Rate (FER)
elements.definition: Rate of Fee which is a percentage of the underlying or Fee Rate (FER) is an absolute amount. For all contracts where Fee Basis (FEB) does not apply (cf. business rules), Fee Rate (FER) is interpreted as an absolute amount.

name: Fixing Period (RRFIX)
elements.definition: Interest rate resets (adjustments) are usually fixed one or two days (usually Business Days) before the new rate applies (defined by the rate reset schedule). This field holds the period between fixing and application of a rate.

name: Grace Period (GRP)
elements.definition: If real payment happens after scheduled payment date plus Grace Period (GRP), then the payment is in delay.

name: Initial Exchange Date (IED)
