name: DayCountBasis
elements.definition: Specifies the computation method of (accrued) interest of the security.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
elements.definition: Code is used to determine the interest computation method.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
Actual360
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
Actual365Fixed
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
Actual365LorActuActubasisRule
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

name: DayCountBasis
Code
Actual365NL
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
ActualActualAFB
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year subperiods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the subperiods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each subperiod and the intermediate results are summed up.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
ActualActualICMA
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, that is, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi-interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi-interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
ActualActualISDA
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall (falling on a normal year, year) divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall (falling on a leap year, year) divided by 366.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30360ICMAor30360basicrule
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that the 31st is assumed to be the 30th and 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be the 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 1 January 1999.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30360ISDAor30360AmericanBasicRule
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be the 28th (or 29th). This is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30365
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be the 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be the 28th (or 29th).

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30Actual
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that the 31st is assumed to be the 30th and 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be the 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30E2360orEurobondbasismodel2
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that the 31st is assumed to be the 30th and 28 Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to 29 Feb when the first day of the interest period is the 29th, or to 30 Feb when the first day of the interest period is the 30th or the 31st. The 29th day of February in a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to 30 Feb when the first day of the interest period is the 30th or the 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on 30 Feb when the end of the period is the 30th or the 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is the 29th, or three days of interest in February when it is 28 Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30E3360orEurobondbasismodel3
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that the 31st is assumed to be the 30th and 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be the 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

name: DayCountBasis
Code
IC30E360orEuroBondBasismodel1
elements.definition: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that the 31st is assumed to be the 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be the 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

name: DayCountBasis
Proprietary
elements.definition: Interest computation method is determined using a data source scheme.

name: DayCountBasis
Proprietary
Identification
elements.definition: Identification assigned by an institution.

name: DayCountBasis
Proprietary
Issuer
elements.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

name: DayCountBasis
Proprietary
SchemeName
elements.definition: Name of the identification scheme.

name: EscrowedIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether an interest bearing instrument is deposited in a fund that will be used to pay debt service on refunded securities.

name: ExtendibleIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether the security is extendible,eg, repayment may be extended or maturity changed.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
elements.definition: Period during which a date might be extended.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
DateTimeRange
elements.definition: Range of time between a start date and time and an end date and time.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
DateTimeRange
FromDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range starts.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
DateTimeRange
ToDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range ends.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
FromDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range starts.

name: ExtendiblePeriod
ToDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range ends.

name: FaceAmount
elements.definition: Unit value of a debt security.

name: FirstPaymentDate
elements.definition: Date/time at which the first interest payment is due to holders of the security.

name: InsuredIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether the instruments is backed by any kind of asset or not.

name: InterestAccrualDate
elements.definition: Start date used for calculating accrued interest on debt instruments which are being sold between interest payment dates. Often but not always the same as the Issue Date and the Dated Date.

name: InterestCalculationMethod
elements.definition: Calculation method used to calculate interest and/or yield for a bond, for example, street convention.

name: InterestRate
elements.definition: Per annum ratio of interest paid to the principal amount of the financial instrument for a specific period of time.

name: LotIdentification
elements.definition: Identifies the lot constituting the asset backed or mortgage backed security issue.

name: MaturityDate
elements.definition: Planned final repayment date at the time of issuance.

name: NextCallableDate
elements.definition: Next date/time at which the issuer has the right to pay the securitiy prior to maturity.

name: NextCouponDate
elements.definition: Date of the coupon attached to the physical security.

name: NextFactor
elements.definition: Identifies the new factor expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1 defining the outstanding principal of the bond (for asset or mortgage backed securities).

name: NextFactorDate
elements.definition: The date that the current factor will be changed to a new factor.

name: NextInterestRate
elements.definition: Specifies the interest rate applicable to the next interest payment period.

name: OddCouponIndicator
elements.definition: Specifies whether the payment of the coupon (interest) on a bond is off the normal schedule.

name: OverAllotmentAmount
elements.definition: Amount for which a security can be overalloted (as in greenshoe option).

name: OverAllotmentRate
elements.definition: Percentage for which a security can be overalloted (as in greenshoe option).

name: PaymentDirectionIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates the direction of payment for asset or mortgage backed securities, ie, whether the repaid capital is distributed (payment direction is down) or capitalized (payment direction is up).

name: PaymentFrequency
elements.definition: Specifies the frequency of an interest payment.

name: PaymentFrequency
Adhoc
elements.definition: Event takes place on request or as necessary.

name: PaymentFrequency
SemiAnnual
elements.definition: Event takes place every six months or two times a year.

name: PaymentFrequency
Weekly
elements.definition: Event takes place once a week.

name: PaymentFrequency
IntraDay
elements.definition: Event takes place several times a day.

name: PaymentFrequency
Monthly
elements.definition: Event takes place every month or once a month.

name: PaymentFrequency
Quarterly
elements.definition: Event takes place every three months or four times a year.

name: PaymentFrequency
Annual
elements.definition: Event takes place every year or once a year.

name: PaymentFrequency
Daily
elements.definition: Event takes place every day.

name: PerpetualIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether the security has no maturity date.

name: Pieces
elements.definition: Number of pieces composing a pool of financial assets.

name: PoolsMaximum
elements.definition: Collection of assets by which a security is backed.

name: PoolsPerLot
elements.definition: Indicates per lot the collection of loans, mortgages or other assets assembled by an originator as the basis for a security.

name: PoolsPerMillion
elements.definition: Indicates per million the collection of loans, mortgages or other assets assembled by an originator as the basis for a security.

name: PoolsPerTrade
elements.definition: Indicates per trade the collection of loans, mortgages or other assets assembled by an originator as the basis for a security.

name: PreFundedIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether an interest bearing instrument is being escrowed or collateralized either by direct obligations guaranteed by the US government, or by other types of securities. The maturity schedules of the securities in the escrow fund are determined in such a way to pay the maturity value, coupon, and premium payments (if any) of the refunded bonds.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
elements.definition: Speed of unscheduled partial or complete payment of the principal amount outstanding on a debt obligation before its due date.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Rate
elements.definition: Rate of prepayment speed of the fixed income instrument.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
elements.definition: Specifies the type of prepayment speed of the fixed income instrument in coded form.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
AbsolutePrePaymentSpeed
elements.definition: Measure of prepayment as a monthly percentage of the original loan balance.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
BMAPrePaymentCurve
elements.definition: Contains the type of prepayment speed of the financial instrument, expressed as a percentage of the Bonds Market Association prepayment Curve.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
ConstantPrePaymentRate
elements.definition: Measure of prepayment as a percentage of the current outstanding loan balance, expressed as a compound annual rate.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
HomeEquityPrePaymentCurve
elements.definition: Contains the type of prepayment speed of the financial instrument, expressed as a percentage of the final Constant Prepayment Rate of the Home Equity Prepayment Curve (10-month seasoning scale composed of even step-ups, terminating at the final Home Equity Prepayment percentage in the 10th month).

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
ManufacturedHousingPrePaymentCurve
elements.definition: Contains the type of prepayment speed of the financial instrument, expressed as a percentage of the Manufactured Housing Prepayment Curve (24-month seasoning scale composed of even step-ups).

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
MonthlyPrePaymentRate
elements.definition: Repayment measure for nonamortizing assets not subject to prepayment. It is calculated by dividing the sum of the interest and principal payments received in a month by the outstanding balance.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
ProspectusPrePaymentCurve
elements.definition: Refers to the pricing speed of a transaction as defined in the prospectus and is specific to the issue which are normally priced at 100 percent PPC.

name: PrePaymentSpeed
Type
SingleMonthlyMortality
elements.definition: Prepayment speed schedule is Single Monthly Mortality, ie, the percentage of outstanding mortgage loan principal prepays in one month.

name: PreviousFactor
elements.definition: Identifies the previous factor expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1 defining the outstanding principal of the bond (for asset or mortgage backed securities).

name: PutableDate
elements.definition: Date at which the holder has the right to ask for redemption of the security prior to final maturity.

name: PutableIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether the holder has the right to ask for redemption of the security prior to final maturity. Also called RedeemableIndicator.

name: SubordinatedIndicator
elements.definition: Indicates whether the security is a subordinated security.

name: VariableInterestDetails
elements.definition: Information linked to the variable interest rate of the security.

name: VariableInterestDetails
Arriers
elements.definition: Indicates that the rate reset will occur at the end of the payment period (True case).

name: VariableInterestDetails
FixingDate
elements.definition: Date/time at which the rate determination is made, also called determination date.

name: VariableInterestDetails
IndexRateBasis
elements.definition: Specifies the reference rate for fixed income instruments where the price of the instrument is indexed to the price of an underlying benchmark.

name: VariableInterestDetails
IndexRateCurrency
elements.definition: Specifies the currency of the reference rate for fixed income instruments where the price of the instrument is indexed to the price of an underlying benchmark.

name: VariableInterestDetails

ResetDate

name: VariableInterestDetails
SpreadRate

name: WeightedAverageCoupon
elements.definition: Contains the weighted average coupon of the fixed income instrument (expressed as a percentage).

name: WeightedAverageLife
elements.definition: Contains the weighted average life of the fixed income instrument (expressed in months).

name: WeightedAverageLoan
elements.definition: Contains the weighted average loan of the fixed income instrument (expressed in months).

name: WeightedAverageMaturity
elements.definition: Contains the weighted average maturity of the fixed income instrument (expressed in months).

name: YieldDetails
elements.definition: Calculated yield based on the price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationDate
elements.definition: Included as needed to clarify yield irregularities associated with date, e.g. when it falls on a non-business day.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
elements.definition: Specifies the type of calculation.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
AfterTax
elements.definition: The yield on the bond net of any tax consequences from holding the bond. The discount on municipal securities can be subject to both capital gains taxes and ordinary income taxes. Calculated from dollar price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Annual
elements.definition: The annual interest or dividend income an investment earns, expressed as a percentage of the investment's total value.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
AtIssue
elements.definition: The yield of the bond offered on the issue date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Book
elements.definition: The yield of a security calculated by using its book value instead of the current market price. This term is typically used in the US domestic market.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ChangeSinceClose
elements.definition: The change in the yield since the previous day's closing yield.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Closing
elements.definition: The yield of a bond based on the closing price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Compound
elements.definition: The yield of certain Japanese bonds based on its price. Certain Japanese bonds have irregular first or last coupons, and the yield is calculated compound for these irregular periods.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
CurrentYield
elements.definition: The ratio of the interest payment amount to the clean price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
GovernmentEquivalent
elements.definition: Ask yield based on semi-annual coupons compounding in all periods and actual/actual calendar.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
InflationAssumption
elements.definition: Based on price, the return an investor would require on a normal bond that would make the real return equal to that of the inflation-indexed bond, assuming a constant inflation rate.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
InverseFloater
elements.definition: Inverse Floater Bond Yield - Inverse floater semi-annual bond equivalent rate.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
LastClose
elements.definition: Most Recent Closing Yield - The last available yield stored in history, computed using price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
LastMonth
elements.definition: Closing Yield Most Recent Month - The yield of a bond based on the closing price as of the most recent month's end.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
LastQuarter
elements.definition: Closing Yield Most Recent Quarter - The yield of a bond based on the closing price as of the most recent quarter's end.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
LastYear
elements.definition: Closing Yield Most Recent Year - The yield of a bond based on the closing price as of the most recent year's end.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
LongestAverageLife
elements.definition: The yield assuming only mandatory sinks are taken. This results in a lower paydown of debt; the yield is then calculated to the final payment date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
MarkToMarket
elements.definition: An adjustment in the valuation of a securities portfolio to reflect the current market values of the respective securities in the portfolio.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
OpenAverage
elements.definition: The average yield of the respective securities in the portfolio.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
PreviousClose
elements.definition: The yield of a bond based on the closing price 1 day ago.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Proceeds
elements.definition: The CD equivalent yield when the remaining time to maturity is less than two years.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
SemiAnnual
elements.definition: The yield of a bond whose coupon payments are reinvested semi-annually.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ShortestAverageLife
elements.definition: The yield assuming that all sinks (mandatory and voluntary) are taken at par. This results in a faster paydown of debt; the yield is then calculated to the shortest average life date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
Simple
elements.definition: The yield of a bond assuming no reinvestment of coupon payments. (Act/360 day count).

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
TaxEquivalent
elements.definition: The after tax yield grossed up by the maximum federal tax rate of 39.6%. For comparison to taxable yields.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ToAverageMaturity
elements.definition: The yield achieved by substituting a bond's average maturity for the issue's final maturity date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ToNextPut
elements.definition: The yield to the date at which the bond holder can next put the bond to the issuer.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ToNextRefund
elements.definition: Yield To Next Refund (Sinking Fund Bonds) - Yield assuming all bonds are redeemed at the next refund date at the redemption price.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ToTenderDate
elements.definition: The yield on a Municipal bond to its mandatory tender date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
ToWorstConvention
elements.definition: The lowest yield to all possible redemption date scenarios.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
True
elements.definition: The yield calculated with coupon dates moved from a weekend or holiday to the next valid settlement date.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
TrueGross
elements.definition: Yield calculated using the price including accrued interest, where coupon dates are moved from holidays and weekends to the next trading day.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
YieldToMaturity
elements.definition: Internal rate of return an investor would achieve if he or she purchased that bond at its current dirty price, and held it to maturity, assuming all coupon and principal payments are received as scheduled.

name: YieldDetails
CalculationType
YieldToNextCall
elements.definition: Yield of a bond to the next possible call date.

name: PreferenceToIncome

name: Equity
definition: Financial instrument which represents a title of ownership in a company, ie, the shareholder is entitled to a part of the company's profit - usually by payment of a dividend - and to voting rights, if any. Each company issues generally different classes of shares, eg, ordinary or common shares, which have no guaranteed amount of dividend but carry voting rights, or preferred shares, which receive dividends before ordinary shares but have no voting right.

name: Future
definition: Parameters for contracts which obligate the buyer to receive and the seller to deliver in the future the assets specified at an agreed price.

name: ContractSize
elements.definition: Ratio or multiplying factor used to convert one contract into a quantity.

name: ConversionDate
elements.definition: Deadline by which a convertible security must be converted according to the terms of the issue.

name: ConversionPeriod
elements.definition: Period during which a convertible security may be converted according to the terms of the issue.

name: ConversionPeriod
DateTimeRange
elements.definition: Range of time between a start date and time and an end date and time.

name: ConversionPeriod
DateTimeRange
FromDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range starts.

name: ConversionPeriod
DateTimeRange
ToDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range ends.

name: ConversionPeriod
FromDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range starts.

name: ConversionPeriod
ToDateTime
elements.definition: Date and time at which the range ends.

name: ExpiryDate
elements.definition: Date on which a privilege expires.

name: ExpiryLocation
elements.definition: Financial center where option expires.

name: InstrumentAssignmentMethod
elements.definition: Method under which assignment was conducted.

name: InstrumentAssignmentMethod
Prorata
elements.definition: Assignment was conducted on a prorata basis.

name: InstrumentAssignmentMethod
Random
elements.definition: Assignment was conducted randomly.

name: MinimumExercisableMultipleQuantity
elements.definition: Minimum multiple quantity of securities that must be exercised.

name: MinimumExercisableMultipleQuantity
AmortisedValue
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, eg, a periodic reduction of a bond's principal amount.

name: MinimumExercisableMultipleQuantity
FaceAmount
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

name: MinimumExercisableMultipleQuantity
Unit
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

name: MinimumExercisableQuantity
elements.definition: Minimum quantity of securities that must be exercised.

name: MinimumExercisableQuantity
AmortisedValue
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, eg, a periodic reduction of a bond's principal amount.

name: MinimumExercisableQuantity
FaceAmount
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

name: MinimumExercisableQuantity
Unit
elements.definition: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

name: OptionStyle
elements.definition: Specifies how an option can be exercised (American, European, Bermudan).

name: OptionStyle
Code
elements.definition: Option style is defined using a code.

name: OptionStyle
Code
American
elements.definition: Option can be exercised before or on expiry date.

name: OptionStyle
Code
Asian
elements.definition: Option where the payoff is not determined by the underlying price at maturity but by the average underlying price over some pre-set period of time.

name: OptionStyle
Code
Bermudan
elements.definition: Option that can be exercised on multiple discrete dates prior to, or on expiry date.

name: OptionStyle
Code
Canary
elements.definition: Option whose exercise style lies somewhere between European options and Bermudan options. The holder can exercise the option at quarterly dates, but not before a set time period (typically one year) has elapsed.

name: OptionStyle
Code
European
elements.definition: Option that can be exercised on expiry date only.

name: OptionStyle
Proprietary
elements.definition: Option style is defined using a data source scheme.

name: OptionStyle
Proprietary
Identification
elements.definition: Identification assigned by an institution.

name: OptionStyle
Proprietary
Issuer
elements.definition: Entity that assigns the identification.

name: OptionStyle
Proprietary
SchemeName
elements.definition: Name of the identification scheme.

name: OptionType
elements.definition: Specifies whether it is a Call option (right to purchase a specific underlying asset) or a Put option (right to sell a specific underlying asset).

name: OptionType
Call
elements.definition: Right to buy a quantity of an asset for an agreed price at exercise date.

name: OptionType
Put
elements.definition: Right to sell a quantity of an asset for an agreed price at exercise date.

name: SettleStyle
elements.definition: Specifies whether the option contract settles at the open or close of the market.

name: SettleStyle
SettleOnClose
elements.definition: Settlement is only allowed on the closing of the future contract.

name: SettleStyle
SettleOnOpen
elements.definition: Settlement is only allowed on the opening of the future contract.

name: Standardisation
elements.definition: Specifies whether the terms of the security (underlying instruments, expiration date, contract size) are defined according to the exchange specifications or whether they can be user defined.

name: Standardisation
Flexible
elements.definition: Derivatives defined according to exchange specifications, but certain characteristics can be user defined.

name: Standardisation
NonStandardised
elements.definition: Custom-made instrument between two parties. Underlyinginstruments, expiration date and contract size of the derivatives are not standardised.

name: Standardisation
Standardised
elements.definition: The underlying instruments, expiration date and contract size of the derivatives are standardised.

name: StrikeMultiplier
elements.definition: Used for derivatives. Multiplier applied to the strike price for the purpose of calculating the settlement value.

name: StrikePrice
elements.definition: Amount of money for which goods or services are offered, sold, or bought.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
elements.definition: Type and information about a price.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
Average
elements.definition: Price is an average execution price.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
AverageOverride
elements.definition: Price is an override of the average price.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
Combined
elements.definition: Price is composed of the combined expenses (used in the UK market).

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
GrossOfAll
elements.definition: Price is a gross execution price. The price is an all inclusive price, ie, including all charges, fees, and taxes.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
Limit
elements.definition: Price is the limit price of a limit order, eg, a customer might put in a limit order to sell financial instruments at 67 or to buy at 60.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
Net
elements.definition: Price is a net price, ie, net only of local broker's commission, local fees and local taxes.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
NetDisclosed
elements.definition: Price is net to the disclosed client.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
NetOfAll
elements.definition: Price is a net price, ie, net of all charges, fees and taxes.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
NetUndisclosed
elements.definition: Price is net to the client undisclosed (used in the UK market).

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
NotionalGross
elements.definition: Price is notional gross (used in the UK market).

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
ParValue
elements.definition: Price is equal to the nominal or face value of the instrument.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
RoundedAverage
elements.definition: Price is a rounded average price.

name: StrikePrice
PriceType
Stop
elements.definition: Price is a stop price used in an order to buy. The order becomes a market order when the financial instrument trades at or above the stop price after the order is submitted. In an order to sell the order becomes a market order when the financial instrument trades at or below the stop price.

name: StrikePrice
Value
elements.definition: Value of the price, eg, as a currency and value.

name: StrikePrice
Value
Amount
elements.definition: Price expressed as a currency and value.

name: StrikePrice
Value
Rate
elements.definition: Price expressed as a rate, that is percentage.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
elements.definition: Type of value in which the price is expressed.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Absolute
elements.definition: Price is expressed as absolute.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Discount
elements.definition: Price expressed as a number of percentage points below par, for example, a discount price of 2.0% equals a price of 98 when par is 100.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
FixedCabinetTrade
elements.definition: Cabinet trades are used to indicate prices that trade at a price lower than that available on an exchange and they can be fixed or variable (primarily used for listed futures and options).

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Par
elements.definition: Price is the face amount.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
PerUnit
elements.definition: Price expressed per unit.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Premium
elements.definition: Price expressed as a number of percentage points above par, for example, a premium price of 2.0% equals a price of 102 when par is 100.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Spread
elements.definition: Difference between a market maker's bid and asked price.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
TEDPrice
elements.definition: Price is expressed as Treasury Euro Dollar price.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
TEDYield
elements.definition: Price is expressed as Treasury Euro Dollar yield.

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
VariableCabinetTrade
elements.definition: Cabinet trades are used to indicate prices that trade at a price lower than that available on an exchange and they can be fixed or variable (primarily used for listed futures and options).

name: StrikePrice
ValueType
Yield
elements.definition: Price expressed as a yield.

name: StrikeValue
elements.definition: Used for derivatives. The number of shares/units for the financial instrument involved in the option trade.

name: TradingPartyRole
elements.definition: Specifies the party which is the buyer or the seller.

name: TradingPartyRole
Buyer
elements.definition: Buyer in a trade.

name: TradingPartyRole
Seller
elements.definition: Seller in a trade.

name: VersionNumber
elements.definition: Number allocated by options exchanges to record that an option has undergone a change in its contract specifications (particularly adjustment of the strike price).

name: Option
definition: Contracts which grant to the holder either the privilege to purchase or the privilege to sell the assets specifiedat a predetermined price or formula at or within a time in the future.

name: ExpiryDate
elements.definition: Date on which the warrant expires.

name: Multiplier
elements.definition: Specifies the ratio or multiply factor used to convert from contracts to shares.
